comment: Dr. A is knowledgable, patient, and incredibly observant. He is efficient at the podium and makes good use of limited rehearsal time. He demands high standards without coming off as strict or scary. I have never seen him lose his cool. Great, open communication with section leaders and concertmaster. His replacement pales in comparison.

Dr. A does not just teach lecture courses. He is a great orchestra conductor who loves musical performance. Side note: MUSI 3344 and 1144 are Philharmonic Orchestra (for non-music majors). Main difference between 1144 & 3344: 3344 has 0 credit or 1 credit option (saves $ on tuition).

Very very passionate about subject. You have to attend a ton of events though,some on your own dollar. Not the easiest professor to talk to either. I would still recommend him. Just go to class,take notes,and attend the 4 main events and you will pass.

Mr Alexander is an interesting guy. I found his lectures to be rather boring. He almost fell off the stage a few times and rambles. He takes attendance daily but allows you to miss up to five days. The 2nd & 3rd test cover a lot of material so it can be rather difficult to study. It's not an easy A but just attend the events and study a little.

Mr. Alexander is an extremely nice professor who is willing to help. Attendance at 4 music performances is mandatory. First two tests are multiple choice, last test was an essay. Attend class and study in order to do well.

Guys loves his subject - but not helpful at all - SUPER Strict! He says he'll fail you if you miss or are late 5 classes, but if you ask he won't. Good class in & of itself, I suggest another professor - but he's not all bad, I think he bumped the last few points for me to get a B. Do the attendance things ASAP! He'll be more helpful then.

GREAT teacher. I took this class only because art was full and by the time the class was done, I was actually interested in music and learned sooo much. He is very passionate and fun to listen to. Tests are not too difficult if you study a bit. He really tells you what you need to know. HIGHLY recommended!!
Easy professor. You can only miss 3-4 classes, if you miss 5 classes he will give you a "F" for the course.

This class is required so you might as well take him. he is an intertaining fellow and at 8am its worth watching him. i didn't like the class all that much and you have to listen to the songs to pass but he was probably one of the easier professors that teaches this class. id recommend him.

This class was amazing.  Alexander's passion has rubbed off on me so much.  There was a lot told, but it was all extremely interesting.  The tests are easy because he tells you EXACTLY what to know for it.  Go to class and the performances, you'll be just fine.

he really loves what he teaches and it definitely shows. there are alot of out of class activities which are a pain in the butt but please do them with an open mind. i discovered a whole new genre of music thanks to dr. a. the first test is the hardest if you have no musical experience but the rest of the class is a  breeze if you take notes in cla
Very nice, enthusiastic, goes overthings a few times, easy fun class.
He's very nice! teaches clearly! he tries to make it fun! He's an easy A! he's very into his subject! he knows what he teaches! The best part is going to all those concerts!
Very enthusiastic. Makes class very interesting, and is willing to help.
he is awesome! easy class. he makes it fun, he is so enthusiatic and happy about teaching. very understanding and caring professor.

He really knows what he is talking about. He likes teaching and hates to give tests but says he has too. There are review sheets...if you know whats on the review sheets you'll do fine on the tests. If you never went to class and just went over the sheets you'd be fine. And hes really nice.

He understands that it's not the most exciting information but he tries to make it interesting.  Very understanding and nice.  Show up and take notes and you'll ace the tests.  I highly recommend him.
